info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 3:37PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Transylvania, Henderson, northwestern Polk and northwestern Greenville Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 337 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of Hendersonville, or 4 miles east of Dupont State Forest. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hendersonville, Brevard, Mills River, Fletcher, Flat Rock, Etowah, Mountain Home, Laurel Park, Saluda and Caesars Head State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
